node.text:
Witnesses say at least three people have died following desperate scenes at Kabul airport.
 
Video shows some people trying to cling on to planes as they took off.
 
With scheduled flights suspended, many foreigners and Afghans are now stranded.
 
The US and other countries have been rushing to evacuate staff and allies.
 
On Sunday the Taliban declared victory after Afghan President Ashraf Ghani fled abroad and his government collapsed.
 
The militants' return to rule brings an end to almost 20 years of a US-led coalition's presence in the country.

#Afghanistan #Kabul #BBCNews

node.title: Chaos at Kabul airport as Afghans try to flee the Taliban.

node.text:
A 15-year-old from Sri Lanka has spent his Covid lockdown building a solar-powered tuk-tuk.

The best part is that Suntharalingam Piranawan used scraps for his homemade vehicle - and it works.

#SriLanka #BBCNews

node.text:
"Adult siblings are often the forgotten mourners and the ones that have to be strong for everyone else, so I decided I wanted to do something about that."

Triona was the youngest of three sisters. She died in hospital at 34 years old. A post-mortem examination found a blockage in her bowel as a result of scar tissue.

Her family struggled to come to terms with what happened in the aftermath of her death.

"Losing a sister or a brother, is very much like losing a part of yourself, because they are the only people that are there from the very beginning," her sister Maeveen said.

With the help of her two other sisters, they created the Sibling Grief Club.

#BBCNews

node.title: 'My sister's legacy is the Sibling Grief Club'

node.text:
"Living here is scary. We're in a hurry about what to do."

Roads out of the Afghan capital have been choked with traffic as people fearful of a Taliban takeover try to flee.

Tap the link in our bio for more live updates of the situation in Afghanistan. 

#Afghanistan #Kabul #BBCNews

node.title: People flee Kabul as Taliban enters

node.text:
“I won’t let my daughter play outside because of the shootings.”

Nakia lives a few miles from the White House in a community ravaged by gun violence. 

It’s getting worse in her neighbourhood and in many cities across the US.

Is it time for a new approach to tackle the crisis? 

#BBCCutThroughTheNoise #BBCNews

node.title: America’s deadly surge in gun violence

node.text:
Danyl Hussein murdered Bibaa Henry and Nicole Smallman in London.

The BBC has discovered he was  a member of a web forum, run by an American self-styled black magician, whose instructions about demonic pacts mirror steps taken by the killer.

#BBCNews

node.text:
Anisa Shaheed has one of the most dangerous jobs in the world - a female journalist in Afghanistan.

She is one of many women who fear their freedom to work and study will be curbed again if the Taliban come to power.

Anisa was named journalist of the year by Afghanistan's Free Speech Hub network in April.

She tells us what it's like working in a field and country dominated by men, and what she hopes for Afghanistan's future.

#Afghanistan #BBCNews

node.title: The female Afghan journalist who won't give up

node.text:
At just four years old, Autumn California Bailey is already a skateboarding success with more than 120,000 Instagram followers.

She has been inspired by the Olympic performance of Sky Brown and has dreams of competing in future games.

She told the BBC she wants to be "a ballerina and a pro skater", adding: "Skateboarding is my favourite thing on the planet because it makes me feel like I'm flying."

#BBCNews

node.title: Skateboarding 'makes me feel like I'm flying'

node.text:
“I’m not a terrorist… I will never be a terrorist.”

When Lamin was 15 he attempted  travel from Libya to Europe along with 100 other people. 

On his arrival in Malta he was arrested and accused of being a terrorist.

The captain of the oil tanker says that his ship was hijacked and he was forced by Lamin and his friends to go to Malta.

Lamin says that this isn’t true, but that the captain agreed to take them to Malta.

Because Lamin spoke English he was the one who spoke to the captain and has been accused of hjiacking the ship. 

Lamin is in Malta, awaiting trial. 

#BBCNews  #Malta

node.title: The teenagers pulled from the sea and accused of terrorism

node.text:
“I’m scared that Covid is going to affect me at school.”

Millions of children around the US are preparing to go back to the classroom - just as the Delta variant becomes more widespread.

Now, severe cases of Covid in children are on the rise - but not everyone agrees on mask-wearing.

So what can be done to keep kids safe? 

#CutThroughTheNoise #Covid #BBCNews

node.title: Children and the Covid Delta variant

node.text:
We travelled to a Taliban town in Afghanistan and spoke to the insurgents capturing more and more of the country. 

In the past few months the hardline militants have seized vast rural areas, multiple border crossings and now a number of Afghan cities.

Tap the link in our bio for more on the conflict. 

#Afghanistan #BBCNews

node.title: Life inside a Taliban town as insurgence in Afghanistan continues

node.text:
Witnesses say at least three people have died following desperate scenes at Kabul airport.
 
Video shows some people trying to cling on to planes as they took off.
 
With scheduled flights suspended, many foreigners and Afghans are now stranded.
 
The US and other countries have been rushing to evacuate staff and allies.
 
On Sunday the Taliban declared victory after Afghan President Ashraf Ghani fled abroad and his government collapsed.
 
The militants' return to rule brings an end to almost 20 years of a US-led coalition's presence in the country.

#Afghanistan #Kabul #BBCNews

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by BBC News on August 16, 2021. May be an image of one or more people, people standing, outdoors and text that says 'BBC NEWS'.

node.text:
"The streets are filled with screaming.”

Deaths from Saturday’s 7.2-magnitude earthquake in Haiti have soared to at least 1,297 people.

An unknown number of people are missing and about 5,700 have been injured, officials say.

Archdeacon Abiade Lozama, head of a church in Les Cayes, described the chaos to the New York Times while “people are searching, for loved ones or resources, medical help, water" amongst the devastation.

Tap the link in our bio to read more on the unfolding situation as hope fades for finding further survivors in the rubble.

(📷 Reuters/Getty)

#Haiti #BBCNews

node.text:
A 15-year-old from Sri Lanka has spent his Covid lockdown building a solar-powered tuk-tuk.

The best part is that Suntharalingam Piranawan used scraps for his homemade vehicle - and it works.

#SriLanka #BBCNews

node.text:
"Adult siblings are often the forgotten mourners and the ones that have to be strong for everyone else, so I decided I wanted to do something about that."

Triona was the youngest of three sisters. She died in hospital at 34 years old. A post-mortem examination found a blockage in her bowel as a result of scar tissue.

Her family struggled to come to terms with what happened in the aftermath of her death.

"Losing a sister or a brother, is very much like losing a part of yourself, because they are the only people that are there from the very beginning," her sister Maeveen said.

With the help of her two other sisters, they created the Sibling Grief Club.

#BBCNews

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by BBC News on August 15, 2021. May be an image of text.

node.text:
There were scenes of panic and chaos at Kabul's Hamid Karzai international airport as tens of thousands of people tried to flee from Afghanistan, in a last desperate effort to escape the Taliban. 

Reports said that civilians were injured on the tarmac as there were near-stampedes to get on planes. Eyewitness accounts also said that staff were missing from check-in counters and security checks.

More than 60 countries including the US, UK, and Australia have issued a joint statement saying anyone who wished to leave the country must be able to do so - urging the Taliban to let them go.

Tap the link in our bio for more live updates of the situation in Afghanistan.

#Afghanistan #Kabul #BBCNews

node.text:
"Living here is scary. We're in a hurry about what to do."

Roads out of the Afghan capital have been choked with traffic as people fearful of a Taliban takeover try to flee.

Tap the link in our bio for more live updates of the situation in Afghanistan. 

#Afghanistan #Kabul #BBCNews

node.text:
“I won’t let my daughter play outside because of the shootings.”

Nakia lives a few miles from the White House in a community ravaged by gun violence. 

It’s getting worse in her neighbourhood and in many cities across the US.

Is it time for a new approach to tackle the crisis? 

#BBCCutThroughTheNoise #BBCNews

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by BBC News on August 15, 2021. May be an image of one or more people and text that says 'BBC NEWS "Now that I'm leaving, I think about my family they don't have any way to escape. I don't see a future." 22-year-old student'.

node.text:
These are the voices of people in Afghanistan as the country falls to the Taliban.
 
Militants have entered Kabul and seized the presidential palace after President Ashraf Ghani fled the country for an unknown destination.
 
Eyewitnesses say the militants met little resistance along their way to the capital.
 
Meanwhile, chaos has been unfolding at Kabul's airport as foreigners, Afghan officials and others try to leave.
 
Tap the link in our bio to learn more.
 
#Kabul #Afghanistan #BBCNews

Photo by BBC News on August 15, 2021. May be an image of 6 people, people standing and text that says 'BBC NEWS "I saved many American lives. So, they've really left me behind. Now I'm about to be killed, as is my family." Former interpreter who worked with US'.

node.text:
Danyl Hussein murdered Bibaa Henry and Nicole Smallman in London.

The BBC has discovered he was  a member of a web forum, run by an American self-styled black magician, whose instructions about demonic pacts mirror steps taken by the killer.

#BBCNews

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by BBC News on August 15, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Gerd GerdMul Muller 1945- 1945-2021 BBC NEWS'.

node.text:
Bayern Munich and Germany legend Gerd Muller has died at the age of 75.

One of the best strikers in history, Muller scored 68 goals in 62 appearances for West Germany, including the winning goal in the 1974 World Cup final against the Netherlands.

He also scored 547 goals in 594 competitive games during 15 years at Bundesliga giants Bayern.

"Gerd Muller was the greatest striker there has ever been,” Bayern president Herbert Hainer said.

"Without Gerd Muller, FC Bayern would not be the club we all love today. His name and the memory of him will live on forever."

Click the link in our bio to find out more about the life and achievements of the football legend.

(Getty Images)

#GerdMuller #BBCNews

node.text:
Anisa Shaheed has one of the most dangerous jobs in the world - a female journalist in Afghanistan.

She is one of many women who fear their freedom to work and study will be curbed again if the Taliban come to power.

Anisa was named journalist of the year by Afghanistan's Free Speech Hub network in April.

She tells us what it's like working in a field and country dominated by men, and what she hopes for Afghanistan's future.

#Afghanistan #BBCNews

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by BBC News on August 15, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, child, sitting and body of water.

node.text:
Rescuers in Haiti are desperately searching for survivors after a powerful earthquake struck the Caribbean nation, killing at least 304 people and injuring more than 1,800.

The 7.2-magnitude quake hit the west of the country on Saturday, toppling many buildings.

The prime minister declared a month-long state of emergency.

Haiti, the poorest country in the Americas, is still recovering from a devastating 2010 earthquake that killed about 200,000 people.

Click the link in our bio for the latest.

(Reuters, EPA)

#Haiti #BBCNews
